Displacement_strain_planet.Displacement_strain moduleÔÉÅ

Functions for calculating Legendre polynomial derivatives, stresses and strains and plotting the Knapmeyer et al. (2006) tectonic dataset.

Displacement_strain_planet.Displacement_strain.Displacement_strains(A_lm, w_lm, E, v, R, Te, lmax, depth=0, colat_min=0, colat_max=180, lon_min=0, lon_max=360, grid='DH', lmaxgrid=None, Y_lm_d1_t=None, Y_lm_d1_p=None, Y_lm_d2_t=None, Y_lm_d2_p=None, Y_lm_d2_tp=None, y_lm=None, path=None, quiet=True)ÔÉÅ

Computes the Banerdt (1986) equations to determine strains and stresses from the displacements.

Returns:

  • stress_theta (array, size(2*lmax+2,2*(2*lmax+2))) ‚Äì Array with the stress field with respect to colatitude. This is equation A12 from Banerdt (1986).

  • stress_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the stress field with respect to longitude. This is equation A13 from Banerdt (1986).

  • stress_theta_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the stress field with respect to colatitude and longitude. This is equation A14 from Banerdt (1986).

  • eps_theta (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the elongation with respect to colatitude. This is equation A16 from Banerdt (1986).

  • eps_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the elongation with respect to longitude. This is equation A17 from Banerdt (1986).

  • omega (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the shearing deformation. This is equation A18 from Banerdt (1986).

  • kappa_theta (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the bending deformation with respect to colatitude. This is equation A19 from Banerdt (1986).

  • kappa_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the bending deformation with respect to longitude. This is equation A20 from Banerdt (1986).

  • tau (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the twisting deformation. This is equation A21 from Banerdt (1986).

  • tot_theta (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the total deformation with respect to colatitude.

  • tot_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the total deformation with respect to longitude.

  • tot_thetaphi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the total deformation with respect to colatitude and longitude.

Parameters:

  • A_lm (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the spherical harmonic coefficients of the poloidal term of the tangential displacement.

  • w_lm (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the spherical harmonic coefficients of the upward displacement.

  • E (float) ‚Äì Young‚Äôs modulus.

  • v (float) ‚Äì Poisson‚Äôs ratio.

  • R (float) ‚Äì Mean radius of the planet.

  • Te (float) ‚Äì Elastic thickness of the lithosphere.

  • lmax (int) ‚Äì Maximum spherical harmonic degree for computations.

  • depth (float, optional, default = 0) ‚Äì The depth at which stresses are estimated.

  • colat_min (float, optional, default = 0) ‚Äì Minimum colatitude for grid computation of strains and stresses.

  • colat_max (float, optional, default = 180) ‚Äì Maximum colatitude for grid computation of strains and stresses.

  • lon_min (float, optional, default = 0) ‚Äì Minimum longitude for grid computation of strains and stresses.

  • lon_max (float, optional, default = 360) ‚Äì Maximum longitude for grid computation of strains and stresses.

  • grid (string, optional, default = 'DH') ‚Äì Either ‚ÄòDH‚Äô or ‚ÄòGLQ‚Äô for Driscoll and Healy grids or Gauss-Legendre Quadrature grids following the convention of SHTOOLs.

  • lmaxgrid (int, optional, default = None) ‚Äì The maximum spherical harmonic degree resolvable by the grid. If None, this parameter is set to lmax. When grid==‚ÄôGLQ‚Äô, the gridshape is (lmaxgrid+1, 2*lmaxgrid+1) and (2*lmaxgrid+2, 2*(2*lmaxgrid+2)) when grid==‚ÄôDH‚Äô.

  • Y_lm_d1_t (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1), optional, default = None) ‚Äì Array with the first derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to colatitude.

  • Y_lm_d1_p (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1), optional, default = None) ‚Äì Array with the first derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to longitude.

  • Y_lm_d2_t (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1), optional, default = None) ‚Äì Array with the second derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to colatitude.

  • Y_lm_d2_p (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1), optional, default = None) ‚Äì Array with the second derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to longitude.

  • Y_lm_d2_tp (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1), optional, default = None) ‚Äì Array with the first derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to colatitude and longitude.

  • y_lm (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1), optional, default = None) ‚Äì Array of spherical harmonic functions.

  • path (string, optional, default = None) ‚Äì path where to find the stored Legendre polynomials.

  • quiet (bool, optional, default = True) ‚Äì If True, suppress printing output.

Displacement_strain_planet.Displacement_strain.Displacement_strains_shtools(A_lm, w_lm, E, v, R, Te, lmax, depth=0, lmaxgrid=None, quiet=True)ÔÉÅ

Computes the Banerdt (1986) equations to determine strains and stresses from the displacements. This function uses SHTOOLS to derive the spherical harmonic gradients. This does not support GLQ grids.

Returns:

  • stress_theta (array, size(2*lmax+2,2*(2*lmax+2))) ‚Äì Array with the stress field with respect to colatitude. This is equation A12 from Banerdt (1986).

  • stress_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the stress field with respect to longitude. This is equation A13 from Banerdt (1986).

  • stress_theta_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the stress field with respect to colatitude and longitude. This is equation A14 from Banerdt (1986).

  • eps_theta (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the elongation with respect to colatitude. This is equation A16 from Banerdt (1986).

  • eps_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the elongation with respect to longitude. This is equation A17 from Banerdt (1986).

  • omega (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the shearing deformation. This is equation A18 from Banerdt (1986).

  • kappa_theta (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the bending deformation with respect to colatitude. This is equation A19 from Banerdt (1986).

  • kappa_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the bending deformation with respect to longitude. This is equation A20 from Banerdt (1986).

  • tau (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the twisting deformation. This is equation A21 from Banerdt (1986).

  • tot_theta (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the total deformation with respect to colatitude.

  • tot_phi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the total deformation with respect to longitude.

  • tot_thetaphi (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the total deformation with respect to colatitude and longitude.

Parameters:

  • A_lm (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the spherical harmonic coefficients of the poloidal term of the tangential displacement.

  • w_lm (array, float, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the spherical harmonic coefficients of the upward displacement.

  • E (float) ‚Äì Young‚Äôs modulus.

  • v (float) ‚Äì Poisson‚Äôs ratio.

  • R (float) ‚Äì Mean radius of the planet.

  • Te (float) ‚Äì Elastic thickness of the lithosphere.

  • lmax (int) ‚Äì Maximum spherical harmonic degree for computations.

  • depth (float, optional, default = 0) ‚Äì The depth at which stresses are estimated.

  • lmaxgrid (int, optional, default = None) ‚Äì The maximum spherical harmonic degree resolvable by the grid. If None, this parameter is set to lmax. When grid==‚ÄôGLQ‚Äô, the gridshape is (lmaxgrid+1, 2*lmaxgrid+1) and (2*lmaxgrid+2, 2*(2*lmaxgrid+2)) when grid==‚ÄôDH‚Äô. Quadrature grids following the convention of SHTOOLs. If None, the grid is set to ‚ÄòGLQ‚Äô.

  • quiet (bool, optional, default = True) ‚Äì If True, suppress printing output.

Displacement_strain_planet.Displacement_strain.Plt_tecto_Mars(path, compression=False, extension=True, ax=None, compression_col='k', extension_col='purple', lw=1, legend_show=True, legend_loc='upper left')ÔÉÅ

Plot the Knampeyer et al. (2006) dataset of extensional and compressional tectonic features on Mars.

Parameters:

  • path (string) ‚Äì path for the location of the Knameyer et al (2006) dataset.

  • compression (bool, optional, default = False) ‚Äì If True, plot compressive tectonic features.

  • extension (bool, optional, default = True) ‚Äì If True, plot extensive tectonic features.

  • ax (array of object, optional, default = None) ‚Äì Matplotlib axes.

  • compression_col (string, optional, default = "k") ‚Äì Color of compressive tectonic features.

  • extension_col (string, optional, default = "purple") ‚Äì Color of extensive tectonic features.

  • lw (int, optional, default = 1) ‚Äì Linewidth for the tectonic features

  • legend_show (bool, optional, default = True) ‚Äì If True, add a legend to the plot.

  • legend_loc (string, optional, default = "upper left") ‚Äì Determine the legend position.

Displacement_strain_planet.Displacement_strain.Principal_strainstress_angle(s_theta, s_phi, s_theta_phi)ÔÉÅ

Calculate principal strains, stresses, and their principal angles.

Returns:

  • min_strain (array, size same as input arrays) ‚Äì Array with the minimum principal horizontal strain or stress.

  • max_strain (array, size same as input arrays) ‚Äì Array with the maximum principal horizontal strain or stress.

  • sum_strain (array, size same as input arrays) ‚Äì Array with the sum of the principal horizontal strain or stress.

  • principal_angle (array, size same as input arrays) ‚Äì Array with the principal strain or stress direction in degrees.

Parameters:

  • s_theta (array, float, size(nlat, nlon)) ‚Äì Array of the colatitude component of the stress or strain field.

  • s_phi (array, float, size(nlat, nlon)) ‚Äì Array of the longitude component of the stress or strain field.

  • s_theta_phi (array, float, size(nlat, nlon)) ‚Äì Array of the colatitude and longitude component of the stress or strain field.

Displacement_strain_planet.Displacement_strain.SH_deriv(theta, phi, lmax)ÔÉÅ

Compute spherical harmonic derivatives at a given location (first and second order).

Returns:

  • Y_lm_d1_theta_a (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the first derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to colatitude.

  • Y_lm_d1_phi_a (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the first derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to longitude.

  • Y_lm_d2_theta_a (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the second derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to colatitude.

  • Y_lm_d2_phi_a (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the second derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to longitude.

  • Y_lm_d2_thetaphi_a (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array with the first derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to colatitude and longitude.

  • y_lm (array, size(2,lmax+1,lmax+1)) ‚Äì Array of spherical harmonic functions.

Parameters:

  • theta (float) ‚Äì Colatitude in radian.

  • phi (float) ‚Äì Longitude in radian.

  • lmax (int) ‚Äì Maximum spherical harmonic degree to compute for the derivatives.

Displacement_strain_planet.Displacement_strain.SH_deriv_store(lmax, path, colat_min=0, colat_max=180, lon_min=0, lon_max=360, grid='DH', dtype=<class 'numpy.float64'>, lmaxgrid=None, save=True, compressed=False, quiet=True)ÔÉÅ

Compute and store or load spherical harmonic derivatives (first and second order) over the entire sphere or given a set of colatiudes/longitudes bounds. The spherical harmonic degree and order correspond to the index l*(l+1)/2+m. This routine supports both Driscoll and Healy (DH) and Gauss-Legendre Quadrature (GLQ) grids.

Returns:

  • Y_lm_d1_theta_a (array, size(2,(lmax+1)*(lmax+2)/2)) ‚Äì Array with the first derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to colatitude.

  • Y_lm_d1_phi_a (array, size(2,(lmax+1)*(lmax+2)/2)) ‚Äì Array with the first derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to longitude.

  • Y_lm_d2_theta_a (array, size(2,(lmax+1)*(lmax+2)/2)) ‚Äì Array with the second derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to colatitude.

  • Y_lm_d2_phi_a (array, size(2,(lmax+1)*(lmax+2)/2)) ‚Äì Array with the second derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to longitude.

  • Y_lm_d2_thetaphi_a (array, size(2,(lmax+1)*(lmax+2)/2)) ‚Äì Array with the first derivative of Legendre polynomials with respect to colatitude and longitude.

  • y_lm_save (array, size(2,(lmax+1)*(lmax+2)/2)) ‚Äì Array of spherical harmonic functions.

Parameters:

  • lmax (int) ‚Äì Maximum spherical harmonic degree to compute for the derivatives.

  • path (string) ‚Äì Path to store or load spherical harmonic derivatives.

  • colat_min (float, optional, default = 0) ‚Äì Minimum colatitude for grid computation of SH derivatives.

  • colat_max (float, optional, default = 180) ‚Äì Maximum colatitude for grid computation of SH derivatives.

  • lon_min (float, optional, default = 0) ‚Äì Minimum longitude for grid computation of SH derivatives.

  • lon_max (float, optional, default = 360) ‚Äì Maximum longitude for grid computation of SH derivatives.

  • grid (string, optional, default = 'DH') ‚Äì Either ‚ÄòDH‚Äô or ‚ÄòGLQ‚Äô for Driscoll and Healy grids or Gauss-Legendre Quadrature grids following the convention of SHTOOLs.

  • dtype (data-type, optional, default = numpy.float64) ‚Äì The desired data-type for the arrays (default is that of numpy). This can help reducing the size of the stored array.

  • lmaxgrid (int, optional, default = None) ‚Äì The maximum spherical harmonic degree resolvable by the grid. If None, this parameter is set to lmax. The gridshape is (2*lmaxgrid+2, 2*(2*lmaxgrid+2)), DH2 grid. If None, the grid is set to ‚ÄòGLQ‚Äô.

  • save (bool, optional, default = True) ‚Äì If True, save the data at the given path location.

  • compressed (bool, optional, default = False) ‚Äì If True, the data is saved in compressed .npz format instead of npy, which decreases the file size by about a factor 2. This is recommended when lmax > 75.

  • quiet (bool, optional, default = True) ‚Äì If True, suppress printing output.

Displacement_strain_planet.Displacement_strain.Strainstress_from_principal(min_strain, max_strain, sum_strain, principal_angle)ÔÉÅ

Calculate strains or stresses, from their principal values.

Returns:

  • s_theta (array, float, size same as input arrays) ‚Äì Array of the colatitude component of the stress or strain field.

  • s_phi (array, float, size same as input arrays) ‚Äì Array of the longitude component of the stress or strain field.

  • s_theta_phi (array, float, size same as input arrays) ‚Äì Array of the colatitude and longitude component of the stress or strain field.

Parameters:

  • min_strain (array, size(nlat, nlon)) ‚Äì Array with the minimum principal horizontal strain or stress.

  • max_strain (array, size(nlat, nlon)) ‚Äì Array with the maximum principal horizontal strain or stress.

  • sum_strain (array, size(nlat, nlon)) ‚Äì Array with the sum of the principal horizontal strain or stress.

  • principal_angle (array, size(nlat, nlon)) ‚Äì Array with the principal strain or stress direction in degrees.
